channel.title: Redwan Benmansour on Redwan
channel.description: Recent content in Redwan Benmansour on Redwan

item.title: Connecting an old Roomba robot vacuum to a home automation platform
item.description:
Integrating home automation into a 16-year-old product

The Roomba is one of the first robot vacuum cleaners, marketed in 2002. This technology was revolutionary for its time and quite expensive. Nowadays, many manufacturers offer Wi-Fi-connected robot vacuums with countless features. I remember that we had one of these robots when I was little. After searching a bit, I found it under stacked boxes.

This robot is the Roomba 551, which was marketed in 2008 and brought automatic cleaning scheduling at the time. When trying to charge it, nothing happens. I disassemble it and find a completely rusted and flat battery. I decide to order another one and notice a DIN7 port on the top of the device.

item.title: A DIY solution for monitoring consumption with Home Assistant
item.description: A solution for monitoring electricity and water consumption, integrated into the Home Assistant home automation environment

item.title: GEII students from the Indre IUT present their « Ball and Beam » project at the national EEA Club competition.
item.description: Châteauroux, IUT de l’Indre, le 13 mai 2024. As part of the EEA Club’s « My project in 5 minutes » competition, students Roman Couet and Redwan Benmansour are submitting their video entries today. Their goal:’ to win the competition and the €2,000 prize.
